entry.tran: 无拘无束的;自由自在的;不受约束的
entry.def: If you describe someone as footloose, you mean that they have no responsibilities or commitments, and are therefore free to do what they want and go where they want.

example.ex: People that are single tend to be more footloose.
example.tran: 单身的人往往更加无拘无束。

entry.tran: (单身的人)无拘无束的，自由自在的
entry.def: If you describe someone as footloose and fancy-free, you mean that they are not married or in a similar relationship, and you therefore consider them to have very few responsibilities or commitments.

example.ex: In the eyes of the public, a divorced man is footloose and fancy-free.
example.tran: 在公众心目中，离婚的男人无牵无挂、自由自在。

means.word_mean: 1. free to go or do as one pleases;

sentences.sentence: "Americans have always been a footloose people always moving on"
"a footloose young man eager to see the big city"
